title: Google may soon add a built-in Bluetooth tracker detection feature in Android
content:
Bluetooth trackers have quickly become a hot tech commodity. While companies like Tile have offered Bluetooth-powered tags for years, it was Apple’s AirTags that helped these tiny devices achieve mainstream popularity. If you’re on Android, you usually have to download a separate app from the tag manufacturer to monitor, scan and control your device. But

The post Google may soon add a built-in Bluetooth tracker detection feature in Android appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Google is working on integrating Bluetooth tracker detection capability right into Android. Read on to know more.
